intro: Oenothera orizabae, commonly known as the Mexican evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Oenothera orizabae is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
